page.title: 05HINXHILL ESTATE FARM 4
page.content: The two main crops grown at the farm are corn and potatoes.It is like any other farm,planting crops in the autumn and some in the spring, harvesting certain crops in July, August and others in September.Crop rotation is always in force to ensure that the soil is always kept in good condition.Oil seed rape is used.After one season of it being planted,two seasons of wheat can flourish on the same ground. The farm grows many crops including peas, spring barley and maize.The grain harvested is sold for milling purposes.The grain is loaded into lorries then taken to mills in England or exported.There is also woodland at the farm this includes oak, chestnut, hardwood, spruce, beech, ash and hazel.It is interesting to see that the Hinxhill Oak mentioned in the last Domesday Book is still there today.
